Based on the search results, I found comprehensive information about "Romeo i Julia" and its reception among Polish youth, contemporary Polish film adaptations, and the Lubimyczytać.pl perspective. Here's what the search revealed:

## Polish Youth and Contemporary Reception

Polish readers on Lubimyczytać.pl view "Romeo i Julia" as a universal story about love, with one user noting that Shakespeare "had brains." The modern adaptations, particularly Luhrmann's version, proved excellent at conveying "the spirit and thought of William Shakespeare."(no content)Film adaptations have been specifically designed to appeal to young audiences. Luhrmann's 1996 version, while not a faithful book adaptation, "will certainly appeal to young audiences" as it transported Romeo and Julia's story to contemporary times, starring Leonardo DiCaprio and Claire Danes.

## Polish Film Adaptations and Context

Polish theatrical adaptations have experimented with contemporary settings, including "Jerzy Fedorowicz's version with Nowa Huta punks and skinheads in the roles of Capulets and Montagues."(no content)During pandemic lockdowns, Polish youth turned to school reading materials, with film adaptations serving as an important way to engage with literary classics "mainly discussed in Polish language classes."

## Lubimyczytać.pl Platform Coverage

The Lubimyczytać.pl website covered contemporary discussions about new "Romeo i Julia" versions, including debates about casting choices and "violence on racial grounds" that generated significant online commentary.(no content)The platform features film adaptations, including a version with Romeo Montague (Douglas Booth) who "secretly sneaks into Lord Capulet's ball."

## Critical Reception of Adaptations

Luhrmann's film received significant recognition, winning "two awards at Berlinale in 1997 and four at the BAFTA festival in 1998," with Leonardo DiCaprio receiving a Silver Bear at Berlinale and Claire Danes a Golden Popcorn MTV award.(no content)The adaptation successfully targeted the MTV generation, with Luhrmann casting "young, beautiful" actors who were "known to the MTV generation" while "transferring Shakespeare's plot to a modern setting while preserving the original dialogues."

The search reveals a rich Polish discourse around "Romeo i Julia" adaptations, particularly focusing on how contemporary versions resonate with young Polish audiences and the ongoing cultural discussions on the Lubimyczytać.pl platform.
